document.docTitle: Robustagramma mirabile Cui and Marshall 2005, new species
document.masterDocTitle: Systematics of Robustagramma, a new genus of New World Sphaeroceridae (Diptera)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Systematics of Robustagramma, a new genus of New World Sphaeroceridae (Diptera)

heading.emphasis:
Robustagramma mirabile Cui and Marshall
, new species

subSubSection.paragraph: Body length 1.1–1.6 mm . General color brown to dark brown. Moderately pollinose, without conspicuous patterns.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 349–355.
Robustagramma mirabile
sp. nov. : 349, posterior view of male terminalia; 350, lateral view of male terminalia; 351, lateral view of male internal genitalia; 352, male sternite 5; 353, dorsal view of female terminalia; 354, ventral view of female terminalia; 355, spermathecae.

subSubSection.paragraph: Head: Face, gena and antenna reddish yellow to brown; frons mostly orange to reddish yellow. Vertex dark brown. Interfrontal bristles in 3 (rarely 4) similarly small pairs. Two orbital bristles, anterior orbital bristle distinctly weak, slightly longer than half of posterior. Uppermost orbital setula present between orbital bristles. Inner and outer vertical, inner and outer occipital, and ocellar bristle well developed. Outer vertical, posterior orbital and ocellar bristle similar in length. Postvertical bristles ca . 2/5 as long as inner occipital bristles, convergent. Postocellar bristle absent. Facial ridge between antennae slightly wider than width of scape. Eye height ca . 2.5–3.0 times genal height. Arista slightly longer than head height. Aristal hairs nearly 2.5 times as long as basal width of arista. Maximum width of palpus ca . 1/5 as long as palpus. Preapical palpal bristle ca . 1.5–2.0 times as long as maximum width of palpus.

Thorax: Prosternum narrow, bare. Dorsocentral bristles in 2 postsutural pairs, anterior pair similar in length to middle prescutellar acrostichal bristles. Presutural dorsocentral setulae slightly longer than acrostichal setulae. Acrostichal setulae in 8 irregular rows between anterior postsutural dorsocentral bristles. Apical scutellar bristle ca . 1.7 times as long as scutellum. Posterodorsal katepisternal bristle half as long as distance between bristle base and wing base; anterodorsal katepisternal bristle small. Halter knob pale to brown; stem yellowish. Wing half as broad as long, very lightly pigmented, with two indistinct, transverse, clear bands beyond intersection of R 2+3 and costa. Length of second costal sector ca . 0.41–0.46X length of third. R 2+3 short and straight. R 4+5 and costa ending together before wing apex. Discal cell rounded, without appendices. Tarsi and fore tibiae yellow to brownish. Mid tibia with a posterodorsal proximal bristle, an anterodorsal bristle at middle, and an anterodorsal, dorsal and posterodorsal distally; dorsal bristle small. Mid tibia of male with an apicoventral and several short ventral bristles on distal third; also corresponding femur with a row of 3 or 4 ventral proximal bristles.

Male abdomen: Sternite 5 nearly twice as long as sternite 4, with a characteristic pair of dark posterolateral lobes, a pale central area and a spinulate posteromedial margin. Dorsomedial length of epandrium ca . 0.33X length of sternite 8. Surstylus almost entirely setose, with a long, tapering anterior lobe. Cercus shorter than surstylus, with very narrow distal half. Ejaculatory apodeme small.
Female abdomen: Spermathecae hemispherical; ducts of paired spermathecae over three times as long as spermathecal body.

Etymology: The specific epithet,
mirabile
, refers to the distinctive sternite 5 of the male.
